title: Age structure in South Africa 2018
summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 3 lines denoting 0-14 years, 15-64 years, and 65 years and older. The y axis indicates the Share of total population and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall 0-14 years, 15-64 years, and 65 years and older are roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. 15-64 years, 2. 0-14 years, and lastly, 3. 65 years and older.
Throughout the period, 15-64 years generally had the highest Share of total population relative to others with an average of 65.59, and it reached its maximum at 2014 with a value of 65.7.
Followed by 0-14 years which ranks as the second topmpost line , with an average of 29.4 Share of total population,reaching its highest point  at 2008 with a value of 30.0.
65 years and older mostly had the least Share of total population with a mean value of 4.95, which peaked at 2018 with a value of 5.32.

max_summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 3 lines denoting 0-14 years, 15-64 years, and 65 years and older. The y axis indicates the Share of total population and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall 0-14 years, 15-64 years, and 65 years and older are roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. 15-64 years, 2. 0-14 years, and lastly, 3. 65 years and older.
Overall across the Year, 15-64 years mostly maintained the highest Share of total population when compared to others with a mean value of 65.59, and it peaked at 2014.
After 15-64 years, 0-14 years overall has the second highest values , with a mean value of 29.4, peaking at 2008.
65 years and older mostly had the least Share of total population with a mean value of 4.95, which peaked at 2018 with a value of 5.32.
The minimum Share of total population about 4.73, occured at 2008 by 65 years and older.
